image.altText: Daniel Venables celebrates a goal for West Coast against the Bulldogs

props.synopsis: Former West Coast Eagles player Daniel Venables has reactivated a legal case against the club and the AFL over a head injury he received in 2019.

title.children: Former West Coast player Daniel Venables revives compensation bid after major on-field collision

image.altText: Illuminated purple and white Telstra Shop signage outside Brisbane CBD store.

props.synopsis: Residents in WA's southern Wheatbelt have been left dismayed after Telstra told them to buy more communications services to avoid future blackouts.

title.children: Telstra tells angry WA customers to buy more services after week-long mobile, internet outage

image.altText: Demountable-style buildings at a dusty construction site.

props.synopsis: A major lithium company is looking to sell a camp with the capacity to accommodate almost 400 workers after cutting jobs and scaling back expansion plans at its refinery south of Perth.

title.children: US resources giant looks to sell unfinished workers' camp as lithium price crawls 'along the bottom'

image.altText: Large yellow ant hill-like structures in yellow sand under a blue cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: Western science has long debated when the towering pillars of the Pinnacles came to be. A new study suggests most of the spires formed when a particularly wet period dissolved the surrounding rock.

title.children: They may look like ant hills, but WA's Pinnacles are 100,000 years old, study suggests

image.altText: The Karratha Gas Plant

props.synopsis: Far from shoring up the state's gas supplies, industry analysts say the WA government's approach incentivises more exports.

title.children: Analysts warn household gas prices likely to rise as WA encourages more drilling

image.altText: The front gate of a medium security prison.

props.synopsis: The state's work safety watchdog will take the operator of Bunbury Regional Prison to court, claiming it failed to have systems in place to deal with allegations of sexual harassment and bullying.

title.children: WorkSafe to take justice department to court after alleged sexual harassment and bullying at WA prison

image.altText: Radha Mitchell leans into Jesse Spencer, who is driving car.

props.synopsis: Time-warping back to 1979 Perth, the show casts former Neighbours stars Radha Mitchell and Jesse Spencer as a married couple navigating social upheaval and teenage daughters.

title.children: In the 1970s, a US space station crashed into WA. The drama has been turned into a new Australian series

image.altText: Smoke rises from the site of an Israeli airstrike in Dahiyeh, Beirut, Lebanon.

props.synopsis: The Lebanese health ministry says five people were killed and at least 11 injured in an Israeli raid targeting a district in the centre of Beirut, as Australia's foreign minister urges citizens to leave Lebanon.

title.children: Wong tells Australians 'do not wait' to leave as invasion escalates in Lebanon

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Sydney's pro-Palestinian events set to go ahead
Who pays for the evacuation flights out of Lebanon?
Former Mossad director says Netanyahu has to be careful about his next steps

image.altText: A displaced child sleeps at a makeshift encampment on the beach

props.synopsis: In Beirut, a makeshift encampment has been set up on the beach, with scores of displaced people seeking shelter.

title.children: Families seek shelter on the streets of Beirut as Israeli bombardment continues

image.altText: comet trevor dobson

props.synopsis: Described as one of the brightest comets in recent years, it could return looking even more impressive later this month if it survives a close call with the sun.

title.children: 'Amazing' comet puts on a show in Australian skies for astrophotographers

image.altText: Jacqui Lambie speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: After the federal government announced another budget surplus, Jacqui Lambie had a blunt assessment: "Nobody gives a stuff." It shows how far the political discourse has moved in recent years.

title.children: A blunt surplus assessment from Jacqui Lambie shows just how far our budget discourse has shifted

image.altText: A woman with grey hair sits in a chair in a house, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: Days before Christmas, Maurine's retirement village threatened her with eviction. Advocates say village operators have an incentive to churn residents to maximise revenue from exit fees.

title.children: The tactics retirement villages use to churn residents and maximise profits

image.altText: A side-on court sketch of a man standing in court wearing a blue face mask.

props.synopsis: A man who broke into the bedroom of a seven-year-old, taped her mouth shut and choked her unconscious before sexually assaulting her is found guilty by a Perth judge.

title.children: Man found guilty of choking, raping child in Perth home with judge rejecting mental impairment defence

image.altText: Tony Armstrong wearing a white T shirt and a denim jacket.

props.synopsis: Barely 24 hours after the ABC committed to a suite of actions to stamp out racism experienced by their First Nations and culturally and linguistically diverse staff, the broadcaster's Director News was again publicly calling it out.

title.children: Trolling of Tony Armstrong shows exactly why action is needed to stamp out racism at the ABC and beyond

image.altText: A performer in Song Circle on the moving sand stage

props.synopsis: The Noongar season of Kambarang in south-west WA is set to begin with five days of song, dance and music designed to promote joy and healing.

title.children: Joyful celebration of Noongar culture to mark the return of flowers and warm weather

image.altText: Black and white image woman holding an ice cream next to a scruffy puppet named Agro

props.synopsis: Former TV presenter Fiona MacDonald, best known for her work on the children's program Wombat and game show It's a Knockout, has died aged 67.

title.children: 'Let's not call it goodbye': Former children's TV host Fiona MacDonald dies

image.altText: Joe Daniher of the Lions during the AFL grand final, looking up at the crowd

props.synopsis: Brisbane forward Joe Daniher has announced his retirement from the AFL, just days after helping the Lions win the grand final.

title.children: Lions premiership star Joe Daniher announces retirement

image.altText: Nicola Gobbo, known as Lawyer X, wearing a leopard print top stares out a window

props.synopsis: In evidence in her civil lawsuit against the State of Victoria, lawyer turned police informer Nicola Gobbo says Victoria Police made frequent threats to strip her children from her custody if she did not comply with their orders.

title.children: 'Frequently threatened': Nicola Gobbo says police exercised extraordinary control over her life

image.altText: A man walks with his head slightly down as he leaves a court house.

props.synopsis: Singapore's former transport minister has been sentenced to 12 months jail over accepting gifts including F1 tickets, English Premier League tickets, and a private jet ride.

title.children: A private jet trip and English Premier League tickets lands Singapore ex-minister in jail

image.altText: A woman poses for a person taking a photo with a Swiss flag with the alps in the background.

props.synopsis: The increasing rate of glacier melt has meant Switzerland's border with Italy has been redrawn — here's why, and how.

title.children: How climate change is changing the borders of countries — just ask Switzerland

image.altText: A black and white close up of a woman's face.

props.synopsis: Some are concerned banning young people from social media could prevent marginalised people from finding "life-saving" resources they may not be able to access offline.

title.children: Marginalised young people say social media ban would cut off a key lifeline

image.altText: A campaign placard.

props.synopsis: Kamala Harris needs to win Michigan, but the Republican strategy to swing the state is stronger than you might think.

title.children: 'They will vote Trump': The troubling signs for Democrats in a state Kamala Harris must win

image.altText: Donald Trump purses his lips as he stands in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Donald Trump laid the groundwork to try overturn the 2020 election even before he lost, knowingly pushed false claims of voter fraud, and "resorted to crimes" in his failed bid to cling to power, according to a newly unsealed court filing.

title.children: 'Resorted to crimes': Court filing reveals new details of Trump's attempt to overturn 2020 election

image.altText: People bearing Palestinian and Lebanese flags demonstrate outside NSW Supreme Court

props.synopsis: NSW Police and the Palestine Action Group have reached a compromise over planned pro-Palestinian events scheduled to take place in Sydney this long weekend.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian protest to go ahead in Sydney on Sunday after police reach compromise with organisers

image.altText: A mobile screen with a blurred image of a person

props.synopsis: The federal opposition has called for urgent action to prevent the personal data of Australia's national security personnel being on-sold to foreign actors after a new report exposed a blackmail risk.

title.children: Your sensitive personal data is shared almost 500 times a day by the online ad industry

image.altText: Praveen Jayawickrama celebrates a Test wicket

props.synopsis: A failure to report an approach to fix international matches has landed Sri Lankan spinner Praveen Jayawickrama in big trouble with the ICC.

title.children: Sri Lankan cricketer banned from all forms of cricket for a year after breaching anti-corruption code

image.altText: An older, grey-haired man in reading glasses sits indoors.

props.synopsis: For the first time in NSW the Catholic Church has been found to be directly and vicariously liable for a man's abuse by a priest in the 1960s.

title.children: Dying man awarded more than $500k in damages in 'landmark' case involving Catholic priest

image.altText: Building is half torn down.

props.synopsis: The key front-line Ukrainian town of Vuhledar has spent the last two years fighting tooth and nail to resist repeated attacks from Russia. Now, Moscow's soldiers have taken complete control. What does this mean?

title.children: In a significant victory, Russia has taken the Ukrainian town of Vuhledar after two years of resistance

image.altText: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei

props.synopsis: Iran's "Axis of Resistance" is dedicated to countering US and Israeli influence in the Middle East. Here's a look at the group's key players and their roles in the current conflict.

title.children: What is Iran's so-called Axis of Resistance?

image.altText: An empty supermarket aisle.

props.synopsis: Ever noticed more air and less chips in a packet, even though it's being sold for the same price? The federal government says it has a plan to tackle "shrinkflation" by setting stricter rules around pricing.

title.children: 'Shrinkflation' is lightening your shopping trolley while you pay the same price. The government wants to redo pricing rules

image.altText: A young girl crouches on the ground wearing a pink jumper and beanie, smiling

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has been imprisoned after the buggy he was driving with seven children on board flipped and killed his daughter's friend in 2021.

title.children: 'Slap in the face': Family of 6yo killed in farm buggy crash call for tougher penalties

image.altText: Two Supercars going around the first corner at Mount Panorama during the Bathurst 1000.

props.synopsis: This year's Bathurst 1000 will have more battling on track according to driver Thomas Randle, as Supercars make a change in tyre compounds for the Great Race.

title.children: Changes made to the Bathurst 1000 as different tyres are hoped to bring more action

image.altText: Holly from Fat Bear Week

props.synopsis: With Alaska's bears fat, fluffy and stuffed full of salmon, Fat Bear Week is upon us.

title.children: The internet's beloved Fat Bear Week returns after deadly attack delayed reveal
